text: Hi everyone, I'm a master student in Bioinformatics! I got to Julia primarily because how nice DifferentialEquations.jl looked to me. Now I'm intrigued by the concept of a whole language and community specifically for scientific computing. For my work, I'm now researching whether and how I can rebuild a Python package for nanoparticle injection in Julia, for performance reasons and perhaps maintainability :slightly_smiling_face: And for my upcoming master's thesis about phase retrieval, I'm also curious about using Flux.jl.
